If you want to create a boot USB for booting iso files you can use any dd like tool to copy super grub2 disk to a USB drive. It contains a script that will detect loop bootable isos (at boot time) in /boot-isos/ and make menu entries for them.
Of course, the downside being that you loose whatever is on the flash drive currently (unless you do some hackery with the partition table)
